result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter John Trader Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcahrge, plus costs and disburseents.  All monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation. Follow any treatment recommended.

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs. Take as prescribed and only for as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.  Must advise of doctors as to all medications prescribed, inclluding any Oxycodone.
No alcohol.
No contact with Jamie B.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample unless previously provided.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Fine of $600.00 plus the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements. All monies should be takne while serving prison sentence on count one.
Court ordered defendant to complete a driver assessment and safety plan.  Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.
*8/17/2015 credit of 117 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter John Trader Jr

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Peter John Trader not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Peter John Trader not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared on behalf of Francesco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Mneo contacted by phone to obtain date; are still awaiting blood test results.  Case is adjourned for scheduling conference before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Peter John Trader not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Francesco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Peter John Trader in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Peter John Trader in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Peter John Trader in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Peter John Trader in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
